creator: alejandro@lay.com.mx
text:
All of the spanish (es) server error messages are 'semi' translated or textually
translated, which should not be the case. As far as I would say, translations
for errors should be made such that the end user can understand what is going
on. So I am submitting translations that do exactly that.

HTTP_NOT_ACCEPTABLE:

Content-language: es
Content-type: text/html
Body:----------es--
<!--#set var="TITLE" value="Ningún objecto apropiado disponible!" -->
<!--#include virtual="include/top.html" -->

	Una representación apropiada de los recursos
	solicitados no ha podido ser localizada en este servidor.

<!--#include virtual="include/bottom.html" -->
----------es--

creator: rbowen@apache.org
text: There doesn't appear to be a NOT ACCEPTABLE (406) error document in any language. Where did you translate this from?
Thanks for the patch. Closing as 'invalid' because there isn't a NOT ACCEPTABLE error doc at this time.
creator: rbowen@apache.org
